TopicTitle: The "You know you're playing a lot of KSP when..." thread

Articles.Content:
On 12/1/2016 at 1:16 AM, TheKosanianMethod said:

While sitting in the gym, you see three girls sitting in a triangle tossing a ball around, and they have their legs out as to keep the ball in their circle.

Then you think, "That is a perfect representation of a perfect keosynchronous comms network with three satellites and their FOVs."

Just happened. 

Unlike normal people seeing girls sitting in a circle, who would just try and talk to them.

On 12/13/2016 at 8:28 PM, Rath said:

Unlike normal people seeing girls sitting in a circle, who would just try and talk to them.

What is this thing you call "social interaction. "

• When you have a printed Delta-V map next to your desktop.
  • When you have completely memorized the Delta-V map.
  • When you wonder why NASA doesn't use HyperEdit.

On 12/16/2016 at 10:26 PM, TheKosanianMethod said:

What is this thing you call "social interaction. "

That's not social Interaction, it's driving from the other head.

On 12/16/2016 at 10:26 PM, TheKosanianMethod said:

What is this thing you call "social interaction. "

That's not social Interaction, it's driving from the other head.

On 21/5/2013 at 9:59 AM, ZingidyZongxxx said:

Ha, too much KSP. You're funny.

Also, I now say Mun instead of Moon.

This happens to me recently when I talked to my family.

*News talking about the "Super Moon"*

Me: "That's funny. The news said the Mun is the only satellite on Earth. There should be two satellite around Earth."

Family: "Two?! Which two?"

Me: "Well...... Mun and Min.......................................... Wait..........."

When the last day of the semester I am grading the last exams and I have a mechJeb making several nodes to continue the game and the travels of my ships, to advance on my current game (near of 200 hours)

And one of the exercises of the Test is a orbits of phobos and deimos around Mars, only 2 students made it correctly until now.
When your Steam hours equate to almost a month.

I was about to send a risky text to a girl IIRC, so I thought "ooh, better quicksave... wait what?".


I tried to quicksave IRL. 

I remember being slightly confused about how one actually does that BEFORE I remembered that F5 is for games, not reality..

19 hours ago, RandomUser said:

When your Steam hours equate to almost a month. 

awww bless you

On 12/13/2016 at 1:33 PM, TheSealBrigade said:

When you discover that Steam counted 643 hours of play time.

When you discover that Steam counts 4783 hours of play time, and another 1200 in nonsteam installs.
You go to turn the music off... and it already is.
You know you play KSP too much when you apply to NASA with a screenshot of one of your creations and a caption saying "I did it in KSP, hire me."
When your pant/short/whatever-you-wear back pockets are full of small "prototypes" and trajectories diagrams you made while waiting until your next game's dose.

So I researched the TWR and DV of the falcon 9 for reasons and came up with a total DV of 14,000 and something m/s. I'm like "wow! That is a lot of DV!" and then I remember it's for Earth, not Kerbin.

Fire
When you watch movies like Apollo 13 and wonder 'Why don't they just turn SAS on?'
You know you're playing  a lot of KSP when you tried all 1,4931x1037 possible orders to unlock the tech tree.

You know you are playing a lot of ksp when you are on a long boring drive and try to time wrap it. But then you realize you cannot time wrap while moving on terrain. And finally you conclude that you need help!

When you have a dream in which you have a glimpse of 3D model of the Moon on TV. A very detailed model with all the terrain clearly visible, especially edges of biggest craters as the point of view flies... And then you realize it's not the Moon - it's the Mun!

P.S. There was the planet briefly shown, too - although I didn't see enough to distinguish if that was Earth or Kerbin

...when you are pressing c to turn off snap...in another program...five times in a row...which happened just now.

I think I'm going to remap all keybindings in all my drawing/vector programs to fit with the KSP keymapping......omg, thats another "you know when..."

Need help edit: need more time off work

 

Edited January 29, 2017 by Epicdreamer

It's come to the point where I accidentally say KSP's counterparts instead of our planet's actual name.

*Searching Wikipedia*

Let me search... Duna, UH I mean Mars rovers...

On 1/27/2017 at 10:14 AM, DarkOwl57 said:

When you watch movies like Apollo 13 and wonder 'Why don't they just turn SAS on?'

When you watch things like Apollo 13 and wonder why they didn't just pop timewarp on and off, realize "Oh yeah, NASA uses Persistent Rotation.", then realize real life doesn't have mods and that your entire line of thought has been silly.

You know you've played a lot of KSP when you remember a mod from 5 years ago and on searching discover that the links haven't been hosted for years... but then find the zip file in your KSP archives.

Edited January 30, 2017 by Avera9eJoe

I'm not quite at these points yet.

But I have cought myself saying "Kerbonaut" instead of "Kosmonaut" just today.

15 minutes ago, Delay said:

I'm not quite at these points yet.

But I have cought myself saying "Kerbonaut" instead of "Kosmonaut" just today.

Oh, don't worry. You soon will... yes, soon you will...

Food ? Sleep ? Jeb ?

Need to build ship now.
